Posts.Content: Smile - so so true! Thank you for reminding me. What I tell my children seems, sometimes, not to  lodge in my brain for me. Let the beauty on the inside come out and dazzle anyone that’s looking then the outside doesn’t matter. Right, off into town today with my clumps to buy scarves with a positive outlook - thanks for your support!
Posts.Title: Hair loss.

Posts.Content: So my hair has started falling out in little clumps. Does anyone know if this will continue until it’s all gone, or if I’ll wake up tomorrow and need to vacuum my bed? I’m on FEC-T if that has any influence. The children are keen for it not to blow away in the wind while we walk the dog and I’m not keen on doing the food shop if I’m going to shed on the cheese counter. Sorry if I sound flippant, it’s all rather surreal. Any advice will be gratefully received!
Posts.Title: Hair loss.

Posts.Content: Ok, thank you - I'll buzz it off when the children go back to school next week (gulp). I actually feel more emotional about the eyebrows and eyelashes than the head hair as you can't disguise those and I can already see the effort of keeping my chin up when people look at me and judge - I refuse to feel like a victim of my circumstances but will have to hone my soft skills in order not to upset the more sensitive peeps in my life...
